alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 2:14PM EST until March 03 at 4:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Northern Kentucky and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN, Ohio and Ripley. In Kentucky, Boone, Campbell and Kenton. In Ohio, Butler, Clermont, Clinton, Hamilton and Warren. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM EST, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding has been reported in some areas, with a few inches of water on some area roadways. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible through 4 PM. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Covington, Mason, Florence, Independence, Oxford, Lebanon, Norwood, Forest Park, Erlanger, Springboro, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash and Loveland.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
